author: FRONTLINE PBS | Official
description:
Dan Driscoll attended Yale Law School with JD Vance. He is currently the U.S. secretary of the Army and acting director of the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives under the second Trump administration.

The following interview was conducted by Gabrielle Schonder for FRONTLINE on August 13, 2024, before Driscoll joined the administration. It has been edited for clarity and length. See a more complete description of our process here: https://to.pbs.org/4lVZKzA

Dan Driscoll's interview for our 2024 documentary "The VP Choice: Vance vs. Walz" is being published as part of FRONTLINE’s Transparency Project, an effort to open up the source material behind our documentaries. Explore the transcript of this interview, and others, on the FRONTLINE website: https://www.pbs.org/wgbh/frontline/about-frontlines-transparency-project/

Explore a collection of more interviews from “The VP Choice” on our website: https://www.pbs.org/wgbh/frontline/interview-collection/the-vp-choice-vanc
title: The VP Choice: Vance vs. Walz: Dan Driscoll (interview) | FRONTLINE
